description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Hakone" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Hakone

places.generalDescription: Hakone Shrine is a historic Shinto shrine located in a lush lakeside setting. It features a small museum and is known for its iconic red torii gate that can be spotted from the waters of Lake Ashi. The shrine is believed to bring luck in battle and has been revered by prominent historical figures like shogun Tokugawa Ieyasu and ruler Minamoto no Yoritomo.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre taking the ‚Äòpirate ship‚Äô from Togendai to Moto-Hakone, don‚Äôt forget to pay a visit to the Hakone Shrine, with its red torii gate that can be seen from the waters. Said to bring luck in battle, its powers have been trusted by the likes of shogun Tokugawa Ieyasu and 12th-century ruler Minamoto no Yoritomo. For a double dose of spiritual clout, continue your walk for another ten minutes to Kuzuryu Shrine, which draws on the legend of a nine-headed dragon that managed to calm a poisonous monster that terrorised Lake Ashi way back in the Nara period (710-794).
sources.shortName: Guide to Hakone: Best things to do, museums, restaurants, hotels and bars

sources.snippet: Religious monuments like Hakone Shrine and Choanji Temple are well worth the goshuinchou (temple book) stamp. Hakone-Machi was once one of the main routes along an ancient highway linking Eastern and Western Japan and therefore has the stunning Hakone Checkpoint. Slightly further out in Odawara is Odawara Castle, a fine specimen of a castle that historically dates back to Japan‚Äôs 15th century (although it has been rebuilt and restored many times).
sources.shortName: Hakone - GaijinPot Travel

sources.snippet: Hakone Shrine is rather beautiful and atmospheric, starting with its lantern-lined path through the forest and ending with the red ‚ÄòPeace‚Äô torii gate floating in the water. The latter must be one of the most iconic sights in Hakone. Short of visiting its larger and more famous counterpart at Miyajima Island, this is as atmospheric a Shinto scene as you‚Äôre going to find anywhere near Tokyo.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Itinerary

sources.snippet: The Hakone Shrine is situated at the foot of Mount Hakone along the expansive shores of Lake Ashi. Most of the buildings are hidden in the dense and tranquil forest, except for the iconic torii (a red gate found at Japanese Shinto shrines) that stands prominently on the surface of Lake Ashi. This shrine is 10 minutes from Motohakone-ko, one of the boat piers in the area.
sources.shortName: 18 of the Best things to do in Hakone | Japan Travel by NAVITIME

sources.snippet: Built in the year 757, this impressive shrine is considered a ‚Äúpower spot‚Äù by many Japanese people. They come here seeking assistance in matters of love and relationships, for luck, for safe childbirth, and more. Whether or not you‚Äôre the type to believe in the granting of wishes, the surrounding landscape does give the shrine a somewhat otherworldly vibe.
sources.shortName: Let's go, Hakone! vol.2 Power Spots, Pirate Ships, and Mt. Fuji

sources.snippet: Hakone is a great day trip from Tokyo but it‚Äôs also a wonderful place to stay a few days, relax in an onsen, see Mount Fuji, and visit the iconic Hakone Shrine. There is also a spa where you can bathe in coffee, wine, sake, green tea, and more favorite beverages!. Take some time to immerse yourself in the unique activities in this 2 day Hakone itinerary.
sources.shortName: 2-Day Hakone Itinerary & Hakone Travel Guide

sources.snippet: This grand torii gate is usually the starting point for everyone‚Äôs Hakone itinerary. This famous ‚Äúfloating‚Äù gate isn‚Äôt even the actual shrine!. The actual Hakone shrine complex behind it is huge ‚Äî with flights upon flights of stairs to boot ‚Äî so if you‚Äôre only doing a day trip you may be better off giving the shrine a miss.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places You Should Visit in Hakone ‚Äî A Scenic Retreat From Tokyo Worth More Than A Day Trip

sources.snippet: Hakone is known to be the home to a handful of power spots, and Hakone Shrine is no exception. Situated at the foot of Mount Hakone, the shrine is noted for its five large torii gates, a sharp contrast to the peaceful waters of the nearby Lake Ashi. Visitors to the shrine can pray for anything from good fortune to love.
sources.shortName: More Than Just An Onsen Town: 12 Things To Do In Hakone, Japan

sources.snippet: After making Yosegi Zaiku marquetry, I went to Hakone Shrine, which is one of the most prominent spiritual sites in Hakone. It is located at a 10-minute ride away on Route H Hakone Tozan Bus from the Hakone Sekisho-ato bus stop. You get off the bus at Hakoen Jinja Iriguchi (Hakone Shrine Entrance).
sources.shortName: Travel Hakone on a Budget! Using the Hakone Free Pass (with Prices & Courses

sources.snippet: The Hakone Shrine is a very famous Shinto Shrine in Japan and a well know visiting spot in Hakone. This sacred place has a long history of more than 1,260 years. Hakone Shrine is strongly connected with such famous people as Minamotono Yorimoto and Tokugawa Ieyasu.
sources.siteName: Tourist info by K's House local staffs
sources.shortName: Top 10 must visit sightseeing places in Hakone.

sources.snippet: A 10 minute walk around the lake from the centre of Motohakone is the Hakone Shrine. Right by the lake is one of the most picturesque torii gates you‚Äôll see in Japan. It‚Äôs visible from the pirate ship on the lake, and now we wanted to get a view up close.
sources.shortName: Hakone 2 day itinerary: a helpful guide

sources.snippet: However, the cruise on a rather bizarre pirate ship across this picturesque lake was rewarding, as were the commanding scarlet Torii gates at the Hakone-jinja shrine, a Shinto shrine originally built in 757 on the lake shore.
sources.shortName: Hakone, Japan: A Unique Destination for a Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: You can come to Amasake shop ‚ÄúChaya‚Äù from Hakone-yumoto by bus, get off at Amasake Chaya bus stop. The shop has its own bus stop. Located at this high mountain but still always have people stop by this place.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Places to visit in Hakone | HAKONE JAPAN

sources.snippet: Cruising over Lake Ashi from Togendai to Hakone-Machi is one of the best experiences in Hakone, you can enjoy the beautiful surrounding of Lake Ashi and the stunning view of Mt Fuji at the same time.
sources.shortName: Experience Japan - Hakone - Best Place To See Mt Fuji

sources.snippet: Hakone Shrine ‚Äì This historic and sacred shrine is over 1200 years old. The view from this spot on Lake Ashi is not only beautiful but also connected to legends of samurai warriors and dragons!
sources.shortName: Hakone Onsen (Hot Springs) - Miyanoshita, Japan

sources.snippet: In the Gora area "The Hakone Open Air Museum" , In the Sengokuhara area "Hakone Glass Forest Museum" There are many photo spots in Hakone. Please visit us and take a commemorative photo!
sources.shortName: Must-see for couples! 11 Experience / Leisure Spots to Enjoy at Hakone Onsen

sources.snippet: Then we continue on a little further past Moto-Hakone port, to visit the Hakone-jinja shrine, and see the floating red torii gate again up close.
sources.shortName: Fun day trip itinerary travelling the Hakone Loop
Hakone Day Trip Guide: What to Do and Getting There

places.name: Hakone Shrine

reviews.text: It is one of the oldest Shinto shrines in Kanagawa Prefecture. The torii gate by the lake is one of the most Instagram-worthy spots for a photo. But be prepared for a long queue, especially on weekends when it gets extremely crowded. The Hakone Shrine itself is huge, with many areas to explore. I recommend setting aside at least half a day to fully enjoy the experience and not miss anything.

An absolutely beautiful and serene shrine. I loved how the tall trees towered over our heads and the way the green of the forest mixed with the redish orange colors of the shrine. The architecture was simply stunning. And of course the torii gate on the lake is the main celebrity here. Just know that there's a crazy long line to get a picture with it at all times, some saying it was an hour of waiting. We didn't wait, we decided to admire the main part of the shrine instead.  Don't forget to get some water from the shrine spring, it's said to bring good luck.

#throwback2016

Tucked between mistdrenched cedars and the still waters of Lake Ashi, Hakone Jinja feels less like a shrine and more like an accidental portal to Studio Ghibli. The iconic red torii gate, emerging from the lake like a spiritual submarine hatch, is Instagram bait but somehow still sacred.

Founded in 757 AD, back when Fuji was still updating her firmware, the shrine once drew samurai warriors seeking divine WiFi before battle. These days, it draws influencers in linen shirts whispering ‚Äúso zen‚Äù before posting a Reel with lofi beats.

The walk up through ancient trees is calming except when the fog gets too thick and you start questioning your life choices and the location of your travel group. Bonus: there's also a side shrine for a nineheaded dragon deity. Because oneheaded dragons are just too basic for Hakone. 1200 years of vibes and foggy drama, blessed.

üì∏ Tip: Come early morning for mist, mystery, and minimal humans. Otherwise, enjoy the queue to touch a gate.

places.address: 80-1 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

places.generalDescription: The Hakone Open-Air Museum, established in 1966, aims to blend nature and art seamlessly. It spans across 77,000 acres of Japanese countryside and showcases an extensive collection from renowned international and local artists such as Miro, Rodin, and Yoshitatsu Yanagihara. The museum features outdoor sculptures by notable artists like Henry Moore and Barbara Hepworth set against the backdrop of Hakone's lush hills.

sources.snippet: You‚Äôll find sculptures as far as the eye can see at this unique museum in Ninotaira, which was ahead of its time when it opened in 1969 as the first alfresco art museum in Japan. Here you‚Äôll find around 120 modern and contemporary works of art spread across the expansive 70,000 sqm park. There are works by Henry Moore and Fernand LeÃÅger plus an indoor exhibition hall dedicated to Picasso.
sources.shortName: Guide to Hakone: Best things to do, museums, restaurants, hotels and bars

sources.snippet: Hakone Open-Air Museum is 70,000 square meters in size and features more than 120 art works and sculptures by both Japanese and Western artists. The combination of sculptures backed by the scenic mountains and valleys creates a truly unforgettable experience for everyone, including families with small children, couples, art-enthusiasts and nature-lovers. There are lots of interactive facilities where children can play, many eye-catching sculptures, and even a foot bath for weary adults.
sources.shortName: 18 of the Best things to do in Hakone | Japan Travel by NAVITIME

sources.snippet: The Hakone Open-Air Museum is the last stop on this 2 day Hakone itinerary and it‚Äôs honestly one of the best attractions in Hakone. It‚Äôs unlike any other art museum we‚Äôve been to and features a number of interactive exhibits. We easily spent a few hours there exploring the outdoor art exhibits, sculptures, and exhibition halls, followed by the building dedicated to the works of Pablo Picasso.
sources.shortName: 2-Day Hakone Itinerary & Hakone Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Hakone is not only known for its beautiful scenery and rich history, but also for the variety of museums it hosts. Take a breath of fresh air as you walk around the Hakone Open-Air Museum, featuring larger-than-life contemporary art nestled within the 70,000 square meter green garden. The museum also houses works by Picasso and Henry Moore.
sources.shortName: More Than Just An Onsen Town: 12 Things To Do In Hakone, Japan

sources.snippet: The Hakone Open-Air Museum is Japan's first outdoor art museum, set amidst the rich natural beauty of Hakone. Spanning approximately 70,000 square meters, it features a permanent collection of notable modern and contemporary sculptures. The Picasso Pavilion showcases a diverse range of Picasso's works, including ceramics and paintings.
sources.shortName: A recommended model course for couples to enjoy hot springs and Lake Ashi.

sources.snippet: The next stop on our day trip itinerary of the Round Course would be a visit to the Hakone Open Air Museum, and for this we would need to take a bus. We head to the bus stop, which is located right outside the Moto Hakone Sightseeing Cruise quay, and ask for pointers as there are quite a few local bus routes leaving from here.
sources.shortName: Fun day trip itinerary travelling the Hakone Loop

sources.snippet: There are over a dozen museums in Hakone, but our favorite has to be the Hakone Open-Air Museum. This expansive outdoor sculpture museum on the side of a mountain has lots of fun interactive art and a breathtaking setting. It showcases over 100 modern and contemporary pieces by renowned artists from all over the world.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Guide: What to Do and Getting There

sources.snippet: An unexpected highlight was our last stop, the Hakone Open-Air Museum. Works by Picasso are housed in the Picasso Pavilion Hall and over 1000 modern and contemporary sculptures are displayed in indoor exhibitions and a tranquil garden area. There is even a naturally fed hot-spring foot bath for guests.
sources.shortName: Hakone, Japan: A Unique Destination for a Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: If you visit just one museum in the Hakone area, it should be the Hakone Open Air Museum. This alone is worth a day trip out here ‚Äì there‚Äôs nothing quite like it in Tokyo. Wander around the sprawling, verdant grounds of the Hakone Open Air Museum and take in a superb collection of sculptures.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Itinerary

sources.snippet: I missed out on going to Hakone Open Air Museum on my first visit to Hakone. But I‚Äôm so glad I made it here on my second visit!. This is definitely a place you should not miss, especially if the weather is cooperating ‚Äì most of the art exhibitions are outdoors.
sources.shortName: A Quick Trip from Tokyo

sources.snippet: It is the first open air museum in Japan and it was opened back in 1969. The museum has a huge variety of sections and different exhibitions both located indoors and outdoors. Museum covers a large area of approximately 70,000„é°.
sources.siteName: Tourist info by K's House local staffs
sources.shortName: Top 10 must visit sightseeing places in Hakone.

sources.snippet: You can come to Amasake shop ‚ÄúChaya‚Äù from Hakone-yumoto by bus, get off at Amasake Chaya bus stop. The shop has its own bus stop. Located at this high mountain but still always have people stop by this place.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Places to visit in Hakone | HAKONE JAPAN

sources.snippet: In the Gora area "The Hakone Open Air Museum" , In the Sengokuhara area "Hakone Glass Forest Museum" There are many photo spots in Hakone. Please visit us and take a commemorative photo!
sources.shortName: Must-see for couples! 11 Experience / Leisure Spots to Enjoy at Hakone Onsen
Hakone - GaijinPot Travel

places.name: The Hakone Open-Air Museum

reviews.text: One of my favorite places to visit. It was stunning, the openness of the space, the views with all the art surrounded by nature. The Picasso exhibition is very nice, mostly the second floor with his bullfighting pieces. I felt like you can experience a lot of Japan's unique nature in one place, they have a little foot bath with hot water to experience the ‚Äúonsen‚Äù, a small but charming bamboo forest, you can see the mountains, it is totally worth it. My kids had a lot of fun and enjoyed the play area and interactive spaces

One of the most incredible museums I've ever visited! The installations are so huge and fun to walk through. Even on a cold rainy and snowy day we walked the entire grounds and saw each exhibit. There's a sweet hot foot soak area about mid way through where there is also a gift shop and little cafe. Don't miss going inside the tower with all the stained glass, it's other worldly.

Loved the concept of an outdoor museum, very nice to stroll around the big park going up and down especially in good weather. Many random sculptures and structures here and there (so-so), Picasso exhibition at the middle was amazing (lots of exhibition), the spiral staircase with coloured glass and very nice views from the top. Also, super interesting kids playground with lots of begs and colorful balls. 10/10 recommend this place.

places.address: 1121 Ninotaira, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0493, Japan

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a picturesque setting, the Hakone Venetian Glass Museum, also known as Hakone Garasu no Mori or Hakone Glass Forest, is a delightful museum that focuses on Venetian glassware. It boasts an impressive collection of exquisite glass pieces from various periods, with a special emphasis on those from the Venetian Renaissance.

sources.snippet: It takes about 90 minutes by romance car from Shinjuku to Hakone. From Tokyo day trip Combined with the good access that can be done Persistently popular as a travel and date spot I am proud of. In such Hakone Kayak , fishing , Mountain bike Activities such as glass craft making Craft experience Do you know what you can do?
sources.shortName: Must-see for couples! 11 Experience / Leisure Spots to Enjoy at Hakone Onsen

sources.snippet: The Glass Forest is home of the Venetian Glass Museum and Venetian Modern Glass Museum, where visitors can view more than 100 pieces of Venetian glassware. The whimsical garden, featuring glass work, and Experience Studio are also not to be missed.
sources.shortName: More Than Just An Onsen Town: 12 Things To Do In Hakone, Japan

places.name: Hakone Venetian Glass Museum (Glass Forest)

reviews.text: A beautiful museum. Close to a bus station so it is easy to access. We went here on a super foggy day, so the garden was like a fairy tale. However it might be more beautiful on sunny days since the glass would be more beautiful under the sunlight. Indoor things were not that special, but the garden was very beautiful. Worth to visit.

WOW!!! The sparkles here!! You have to go on a sunny day or at least with the sun peaking through the clouds. The way the light hits the outdoor pieces is UNREAL! Loved all the indoor pieces too. Chihuly is always amazing to see in person. We had just been to Venice about a year earlier and it was so lovely to see it replicated so well here in Hakone! You will not regret exploring this museum, absolutely recommend!

The glass work was more European / American than traditional Japanese styling, but the blending of glass and nature was impressive.  The beaded trees outside, and the hydrangeas where real and glass flowers blended seamlessly were my favorites.  They have several glass workshops to make glass pieces yourself, though you need to be there at the right time, so check the schedules.

places.address: 940-48 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

sources.snippet: Hakone Shrine is a Shinto shrine located along the shore of Lake Ashi. The shrine dates back to the year 757 but was only relocated to the current location in 1667. One thing you might want to do while at the shrine (or any other Shinto shrine in Japan) is purchase an  Omamori, a small amulet containing a blessed piece of wood meant to protect you or you can gift it to your loved ones for their protection.
sources.shortName: A Quick Trip from Tokyo

sources.snippet: And as we approach the end of our cruise, there are also some lovely views of the Jinjya Heiwa-no-Torii - the floating red torii gate near the Hakone shrine.
sources.shortName: Fun day trip itinerary travelling the Hakone Loop

places.name: Peace Torii

reviews.text:
Very nice tori. But make sure you go early otherwise you can easily have to wait in line for 2 hours+.
People take photos like they're posing for Vogue. There's even a sign to stick to 3 minutes max for photo taking. But if there's 100 people in front of you this means crazy waiting time. We were here around 8am and there were just a few people.

If you come in a busy season, be ready to queue up for about an hour to take a picture on the path under the Torii. It gets extremely busy.
The Torii is beautiful and faithful to the pictures, a great sight into the lake.

Walking around is also nice, the lake is picturesque.

So beautiful. One of the prettier shrines I've been to although the picture line in front of the shrine kinda takes away that feeling for a brief moment. I had a nice time walking through here and exploring.

places.address: 80-1 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

places.generalDescription: Onshi-Hakone Park, located on Togashima Island south of Lake Ashi, was once a summer retreat for aristocrats and a state guest house. Covering approximately 15.9 hectares, the park boasts various types of sakura trees, particularly mame sakura, which bloom during spring around Mount Fuji and Hakone. The former Imperial villa on a small peninsula offers stunning views of the lake and surrounding mountains, including Mount Fuji.

sources.shortName: Hakone Travel Guide - The Best Hakone Itinerary & Mt Fuji Viewpoints

sources.snippet: The Prefectural Onshi-Hakone Park extends on the site of XIV Hakone Palace. From here you can observe not only Lake Ashi, but also the surrounding mountains. If the day is sunny and clear, even the peak of Mt Fuji shows itself to the visitors of this site.
sources.siteName: HAKONE  | Your Guide to All Things Hakone
sources.shortName: The Best 6 Views of Mt Fuji in Hakone | HAKONE
Hakone Day Trip Guide: What to Do and Getting There

places.name: Onshi-Hakone Park

reviews.text: Taking the coastal path was a little challenging but beautiful views! All worth it! Glad we made it last minute before heading home.

Nice sightseeing destination. After the hustle and bustle of Tokyo, highly recommend visiting Hakone for some peace. Do be warned, this park is in a very mountainous region and thus is quite a hike. Views of the surrounding mountain forests and lake are absolutely worth it.

There's nothing special about this park, it's pretty normal. We didn't stay there long, maybe on a sunny day it would be better to use it as a place to relax and stay longer. In some parts of it there's a really nice view of the lake next to the mountains.

places.address: 171 Motohakone, ÁÆ±Ê†πÁî∫ Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the serene natural beauty of Hakone, Japan, the Pola Museum of Art is a modern museum that boasts a unique underground design and offers visitors a forest trail experience. Established in 2002 by the Pola Art Foundation, this museum showcases an impressive private art collection amassed over 40 years by Tsuneshi Suzuki.

sources.snippet: Pola Museum of Art‚Äôs superb collection consists of about 10,000 pieces, including French impressionist artworks, Japanese paintings, Oriental ceramics, glassworks and cosmetic utensils. Some of the highlights are Monet‚Äôs ‚ÄòWater Lily Pond‚Äô, Renoir‚Äôs ‚ÄòGirl in a Lace Hat‚Äô, and Picasso‚Äôs ‚ÄòMother and Child by the Sea‚Äô. Make sure to take a closer look at the building itself, too.
sources.shortName: Guide to Hakone: Best things to do, museums, restaurants, hotels and bars

sources.snippet: The Pola Museum of Art (which can be accessed by bus from Gora Station) features an extensive collection of French Impressionist works and Japanese paintings, as well as various glasswork and ceramics. With the intention of preserving harmony with the surrounding natural environment, the majority of the museum building is located underground. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful curation of its fine arts, as well as its proximity to natural scenery.
sources.shortName: 18 of the Best things to do in Hakone | Japan Travel by NAVITIME

sources.snippet: Meet the works of Western painting masters such as Claude Monet "Pola Museum of Art" , Popular for exhibits related to the masterpiece "Prince of the Stars" and French-style buildings "Little Prince Museum Hakone Saint-Exupery" , Japan's first museum specializing in Venetian glass "Hakone Glass Forest Museum" Boasts a beautiful collection of works and jewelery by glass craftsman Ren√© Lalique "Hakone Laric Museum" Such.
sources.shortName: Must-see for couples! 11 Experience / Leisure Spots to Enjoy at Hakone Onsen

sources.snippet: The "Van Gogh Impact" exhibition, held at the Pola Museum surrounded by Hakone's natural beauty, is the museum's first-ever exhibition themed around Van Gogh. Centered around three Van Gogh works in the Pola Museum's collection, including "The Gleize Bridge over the Vigueirat Canal" painted in Arles, Southern France, this exhibition presents a multifaceted view of how his art influenced later generations.
sources.shortName: Hakone in May 2025: Highlights, Events & Festivals

sources.snippet: Built in 2002 to showcase Suzuki Tsuneshi‚Äôs extensive private art collection, the POLA Museum of Art is relatively new. But if you have to visit just one more museum in the Hakone area, this is the one to visit. Set amidst a forest of beech trees, the glass and concrete structure is designed such that it barely looks out of place here.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Itinerary

sources.snippet: The Pola Museum of Art is another popular attraction, showcasing a collection of over 10,000 works of art, including paintings, ceramics, and glassware. And for those interested in traditional Japanese art, the Narukawa Art Museum is a great choice, with a focus on Japanese paintings and ceramics.
sources.shortName: Hakone, Japan: A Unique Destination for a Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: ‚ñ≤From PIXTA „ÄåThe modern entrance to the Pola Museum of Art surrounded by forest„Äç. The Pola Museum of Art is situated amidst Hakone's beautiful natural scenery. It houses a collection of around 10,000 pieces, focusing primarily on Impressionism, including masterpieces by Monet, Renoir, and Picasso.
sources.shortName: A recommended model course for couples to enjoy hot springs and Lake Ashi.

sources.snippet: S Line bus from G≈çra Station (15 minutes, ¬• 310 without HFP). ¬•1,800 ( ¬•1,600 with HFP). The Pola Museum of Art is a beautiful facility with a great collection of Impressionist artists, including Matisse, Monet, and Renoir.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Guide: What to Do and Getting There

places.name: Pola Museum of Art

reviews.text: Great Modern Museum in Hakone. From Gora, there's a free shuttle, you can also use the local bus.  you would need a few hours although, there's about 6 galleries, there's a nice nature walk outside.  If you like modern art it's good place to visit.

A really beautiful museum surrounded by nature üåø They have different exhibitions (depending on when you are coming) and a fixed catalog gallery that is equally amazing!!! The transportation there was easy since they have a shuttle (you can check the schedule in Gora station or from their website).

Obsessed with the nature trail and the outdoor sculptures, makes Pola Museum of Art differ from other museums.

Such a cool museum. We saw the COLOR exhibit and it's one of the best exhibits I've ever seen. So good we had to buy the book. There are lockers to store your backpack and umbrellas if it's raining. These were especially helpful for the nature walk that was through a gorgeous forest. Art outside is my new favourite thing. Highly recommend if you're in Hakone.

places.address: Japan, „Äí250-0631 Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo District, Hakone, Sengokuhara, Â∞èÂ°öÂ±±ÔºëÔºíÔºòÔºï

places.generalDescription: Kuzuryu Shrine Shingu, also known as the Nine-Headed-Dragon Shrine, is a vibrant red Shinto site located near Lake Ashi in Hakone. Legend has it that a monk subdued a nine-headed dragon that demanded human sacrifices from villagers, leading to the shrine's establishment in 757. This historical power spot is believed to bring good luck, prosperity, and improved fortune. It's particularly popular with women who come to pray for love and successful marriages.

sources.snippet: A good luck course that is very popular with women and couples who can enjoy the spectacular view from Hakone Onshi Park by visiting Kuzuryu Shrine, which is famous in the media as the god of marriage, and Hakone Shrine, which is said to be the guardian deity of Hakone. It is a round-trip course that is very easy to drive on 100% asphalt roads with little height difference. Over 400 large cedar trees on both sides of about 300 meters
sources.shortName: Must-see for couples! 11 Experience / Leisure Spots to Enjoy at Hakone Onsen

sources.snippet: Access: From Hakone-Yumoto Station on the Hakone Tozan Railway, take the Hakone Tozan Bus bound for Togendai for 25 minutes, transfer at Sengoku Information Center to the Odakyu Express Bus heading toward Gotemba Station, ride for 2 minutes and get off at "Kintoki Shrine Entrance." 7-minute walk from there
sources.shortName: Hakone in May 2025: Highlights, Events & Festivals

places.name: Kuzuryu Shrine Shingu

reviews.text: 9 headed dragon

Originally established in the year 757, the Nine-Headed-Dragon Shrine [Kuzuryu-jinja] reveres a nine-headed dragon. According to ancient legend, the dragon who lived at the bottom of Lake Ashi demanded a human sacrifice from the local villagers. A monk named Mangan Jyonin saved the villagers by subduing the dragon causing it to renounce its evil ways. The dragon became revered as a dragon king, and these days, a festival is held every year on July 31st to celebrate the nine-headed dragon king.

This Shrine is located within Hakone Shrine.
As always, stairs to the top!

places.address: 80-1 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the highlands of Sengokuhara, The Little Prince Museum is a cheerful tribute to the 100th anniversary of 'The Little Prince' and its author, Antoine de Saint-Exupery. This museum beautifully brings to life the beloved children's tale through a charming French townscape and a picturesque European garden designed by Keiko Yoshiya.

sources.snippet: Meet the works of Western painting masters such as Claude Monet "Pola Museum of Art" , Popular for exhibits related to the masterpiece "Prince of the Stars" and French-style buildings "Little Prince Museum Hakone Saint-Exupery" , Japan's first museum specializing in Venetian glass "Hakone Glass Forest Museum" Boasts a beautiful collection of works and jewelery by glass craftsman Ren√© Lalique "Hakone Laric Museum" Such.
sources.shortName: Must-see for couples! 11 Experience / Leisure Spots to Enjoy at Hakone Onsen

places.name: Little Prince Museum

reviews.text: So sad this place is closing March 31st because it truly is spectacular for Little Prince lovers. It's a whole little village and follows along the story line as well as honoring the author. There was a cafe and restaurant and gift shop too that I was not expecting. I'm so grateful I was able to go before they close. It was busier than usual when I went but still enjoyable.

I forgot the story of Little Princes, but I enjoyed very much. The flower garden
,the French buildings and the princes goods are very good.
The Xmas illumination is wonderful!!
I recommend to visit when you visit Hakone before the museum close!

If you are a fan of the Little Prince, this is the museum you should visit. The gardens, buildings, and exhibits well express the world together and made me want to read the book again.

My one-year-old daughter was also happy to be able to freely walk around in the beautiful garden. She got a bit scared though with some dim areas in the exhibition buildings.

Even the information pamphlet is so cute. The menu at the caf√© was also designed with the Little Prince theme, and I highly recommend this museum.

places.address: 909 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

places.generalDescription: Lake Ashi, also known as Ashinoko, is a picturesque crater lake located in Hakone, west of Tokyo. Visitors can enjoy sightseeing cruises on the lake and explore nearby hiking trails and campsites. The area offers various ways to take in the stunning scenery, including onboard Hakone Sightseeing Cruises or from the shores of Lake Ashi. Additionally, visitors can experience breathtaking views from the Hakone Ropeway gondola or while relaxing in hot springs.

sources.snippet: From Owakudani, get on the cable car (known as the ‚ÄòHakone Ropeway‚Äô) for Togendai and you‚Äôll soon find yourself at the shore of Lake Ashi. Said to be about 3,000 years old, this still body of water is best viewed from the gaudy-looking ‚Äòpirate ship‚Äô that regularly cruises across it. Gazing out from the deck, you‚Äôll be able to spot the distinctive red ‚Äòpeace gate‚Äô of Hakone Shrine, which stands partially submerged in water near the shore, and the majestic Mt Fuji towering over the landscape.
sources.shortName: Guide to Hakone: Best things to do, museums, restaurants, hotels and bars
Hakone Travel Guide - The Best Hakone Itinerary & Mt Fuji Viewpoints

sources.snippet: Afterwards, we warm up over a quick coffee in the on-site cafe, but we don't hang round for long - pretty soon we are boarding the next part of the Ropeway, for some more great scenery as we descend from the crater towards Togendai Port, where we will board one of the Kankosen Pirate Ships for a cruise across Lake Ashinoko.
sources.shortName: Fun day trip itinerary travelling the Hakone Loop

sources.snippet: Take a walk in the hot spring town with a kimono Kayak You can see Mt. Fuji from the top of Lake Ashi Glasswork There are many popular experiences, such as making a memorable item for the two of you. Let's play hard and make a memorable trip!. There is also a plan for great couples, so please have a look.
sources.shortName: Must-see for couples! 11 Experience / Leisure Spots to Enjoy at Hakone Onsen

sources.snippet: These were really worthwhile, providing unlimited transport options in the Hakone area ‚Äî trains, cable car, ropeway (gondola), cruises on Lake Ashinoko, local buses, and also discounts vouchers for 80 locations. At 4000 JPY (about 45 AUD) for two days, or 5640 JPY for three, it was perfect for us.
sources.shortName: Hakone, Japan: A Unique Destination for a Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: Hakone lies within the Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park comprising the beautiful landscape of Lake Ashinoko, Mount Fuji and some of the best onsen towns you‚Äôll ever visit. The Hakone region itself is made up of seven hot-spring towns, each with their own unique characteristics and charm.
sources.shortName: Hakone - GaijinPot Travel

sources.snippet: Lake Ashi dominates the western side of Hakone, with clear blue waters surrounded by mountains. The area offers various viewpoints of Mt Fuji juxtaposed by the crater lake. It‚Äôs a gorgeous place to stay, and trips on the lake are a highlight of any trip to Hakone.
sources.shortName: WHERE TO STAY in HAKONE

sources.snippet: There are two routes for you to choose, one is to Hakone-Machi where you can take your return ride back to Hakone-Yumoto. Alternatively, you can choose another route which is to Moto-Hakone where you will find Hakone Shrine over there.
sources.shortName: Experience Japan - Hakone - Best Place To See Mt Fuji

sources.snippet: Here you can get a gorgeous view of Mt. Fuji on a clear day, take a tranquil boat ride on Lake Ashi, and visit numerous hot springs.
sources.shortName: 2-Day Hakone Itinerary & Hakone Travel Guide

sources.snippet: We recommend visiting the lake early in the day ‚Äî for a better chance of seeing a clear panoramic view of Fuji.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Guide: What to Do and Getting There

places.name: Lake Ashi

reviews.text: Near enough to have a good view of Mount Fuji. But the Lake Ashinoko itself is a nice serene place. Motohakone port is a nice little lakeside village where you can stay the night and wake up early for a walk along the lake and to savour the cool clean morning air.  The iconic Heiwa No Torii gate that sits on the lake waters commands its presence and gets a line of people wanting to take photos there.

We came to Lake Ashi and took the cruise on what looked like a pirate ship. This ship has a lift that made it easy to reach the open deck. It was spring and the wind made it feel very cold on the ship. The lake is pleasant and we could see the Tori of Peace from the deck.

Lake Ashi in Hakone is a scenic crater lake surrounded by mountains, often seen with Mount Fuji in the background. The area offers boat cruises, lakeside trails, and hot springs. A peaceful destination ideal for day trips or weekend escapes from Tokyo.

places.address: Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

places.generalDescription: Narukawa Art Museum, established in 1988, is a private art museum offering a stunning panoramic view of Lake Ashi. The museum houses an impressive collection of over 4,000 modern and renowned Japanese paintings, ranging from works by esteemed artists like Kyujin Yamamoto and Ikuo Hirayama to pieces by emerging talents. The exhibitions are refreshed seasonally to provide visitors with diverse experiences throughout the year.

sources.snippet: In this nature-abundant area, there are many art spots where you can immerse yourself in works of art while enjoying the scenery of trees. Having heard that there is an art museum with a panoramic view of Lake Ashi, Hakone Shrine, and even Mt. Fuji, I decided to head for "Narukawa Art Museum" standing alongside Lake Ashi. With a Hakone Free Pass, you can get a 200-yen discount on the admission fee (100-yen discount for an elementary or junior high school student).
sources.shortName: Travel Hakone on a Budget! Using the Hakone Free Pass (with Prices & Courses

sources.snippet: Hakone Ashinoko Narukawa Art Museum offers a mesmerizing scenery of Mt Fuji and the surrounding area, which you can admire through a gigantic glass window at the observation deck. The best time to visit is in the morning, when the museum isn‚Äôt overflowing with visitors. That way you can peacefully savor the moment.
sources.siteName: HAKONE  | Your Guide to All Things Hakone
sources.shortName: The Best 6 Views of Mt Fuji in Hakone | HAKONE

sources.snippet: And for those interested in traditional Japanese art, the Narukawa Art Museum is a great choice, with a focus on Japanese paintings and ceramics.
sources.shortName: Hakone, Japan: A Unique Destination for a Romantic Getaway

places.name: Narukawa Art Museum

reviews.text:
I believe most tourists visit this place for the stunning window view of Mt. Fuji, and it truly lives up to the hype. The view is absolutely breathtaking and an ideal spot for capturing beautiful photos.

The paintings on display are also impressive. I was delighted to find a collection of ink wash paintings, which I personally love. The local artists are incredibly talented, and their work adds a wonderful cultural touch to the experience.

This place has the best views. You need to pay the entrance fee for the cafe but definitely  worth it. The museum istels is small but has some amazing pieces. The glass pieces were a nice surprise and fantastic, I wish they had more. People saying it is not impressive clearly have no appreciation for actual art.

Came here for the view at the cafe and it did not disappoint. One of the best resting quiet serene atmosphere. The best photo taking spot of Lake Aishi and Hakone Shrine Tori Gate, plus the touristy pirate ship!

places.address: 570 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the picturesque Sengokuhara area, the Hakone "Rene Lalique" Museum is a sophisticated destination showcasing an impressive collection of over 1,500 pieces by renowned French artist Rene Lalique. Visitors can marvel at the intricately designed glassware, perfume bottles, and jewelry that epitomize Art Nouveau elegance. The museum also features a stylish restaurant offering delectable French cuisine and a meticulously manicured Japanese garden for leisurely strolls.

sources.snippet: Ren√© Lalique (1860-1945) was a famous artist in the field of decorative jewellery and glass. Nature inspired many of his works, resulting in motifs depicting insects, birds and flowers. The Lalique Museum Hakone exhibits about 230 items, including glassworks and 40 original and innovative pieces of jewellery, out of a collection of over 1,500 works.
sources.shortName: Guide to Hakone: Best things to do, museums, restaurants, hotels and bars

sources.snippet: It takes about 90 minutes by romance car from Shinjuku to Hakone. From Tokyo day trip Combined with the good access that can be done Persistently popular as a travel and date spot I am proud of. In such Hakone Kayak , fishing , Mountain bike Activities such as glass craft making Craft experience Do you know what you can do?
sources.shortName: Must-see for couples! 11 Experience / Leisure Spots to Enjoy at Hakone Onsen

sources.snippet: The Hakone area is home to a handful of museums, some more worth visiting than others. It can be tricky to decide which one to spend your time on. If you‚Äôre an Art Deco and/or Art Nouveau fan, however, visiting the Lalique Museum is a non-negotiable experience.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Itinerary

sources.snippet: The Hakone Lalique Museum is an art museum dedicated to the works of Ren√© Lalique, a master of French Art Nouveau and Art Deco. The museum houses approximately 1,500 pieces, including jewelry, glass art, and interior decorations.
sources.shortName: A recommended model course for couples to enjoy hot springs and Lake Ashi.

places.name: Lalique Museum, Hakone

reviews.text:
It is a must! They have a huge collection of 1,500 pieces crafted by R. Lalique! They are beautiful!!!
The atmosphere there is peaceful. No pictures allowed and we bought their book.
Their restaurant serves very good European  food (excellent beef) that locals go specially for having lunch.
It is worth going to. Exhibits are very interesting.   There is a relaxing room  you have to spend time there, it will remind you of the painting of Monet.
Has a quite good restaurant reasonably priced. Some interesting exhibits in a really nice museum! Good !

places.address: 186-1 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

sources.snippet: Works by Picasso are housed in the Picasso Pavilion Hall and over 1000 modern and contemporary sculptures are displayed in indoor exhibitions and a tranquil garden area. There is even a naturally fed hot-spring foot bath for guests. Well worth the trip.
sources.shortName: Hakone, Japan: A Unique Destination for a Romantic Getaway

places.name: Picasso Pavilion

reviews.text: This wonderful exhibit is located within the Open Air Museum in Hakone. A visit exclusively here almost makes a trip to this resort town necessary. The 2 floor building showcases several of Picasso's many artistic expressions, including glass, drawings, ceramic, sculpture, and, of course, paintings. The Open Air Museum is the perfect setting for this exhibit.
Perfect escape from the city. Beautiful, relaxing, and plenty to do to spend the day.

From the outside, the Picasso Pavilion at The Hakone Open-Air Museum is a striking and modern structure that stands out within the picturesque landscape. The building itself is designed to complement the surrounding natural beauty while offering a contemporary space to house the extensive collection of Pablo Picasso's works.

places.address: Japan, „Äí250-0407 Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo District, Hakone, Ninotaira, 1121, ÂΩ´Âàª„ÅÆÊ£ÆÁæéË°ìÈ§®ÂÜÖ

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a serene woodland area with streams and hot springs, the Okada Museum of Art showcases an extensive collection of Japanese, Chinese, and Korean cultural treasures. Opened in 2013, this museum houses a diverse array of early-modern Japanese paintings, East Asian ceramics, and Buddhist sacred statues dating back to the 11th century. The modern building seamlessly integrates into its natural surroundings while providing over 5,000 square meters of exhibition space across five floors.

sources.snippet: One of the most impressive museums in Hakone, the Okada Museum of Art displays mainly Japanese, Chinese and Korean art on five floors and across 5,000 sqm. Its collection includes works from antiquity to the present, making for a really deep dive into the history of East Asian art. The museum‚Äôs current exhibition focuses on the four seasons through 100 artworks, including Japanese paintings, ceramics and lacquerware.
sources.shortName: Guide to Hakone: Best things to do, museums, restaurants, hotels and bars

sources.snippet: The Okada Museum of Art is a privately-owned museum that exhibits an extensive collection of Japanese Edo-period silk screens, East Asian ceramics and sculptures. The museum can be accessed by either the Izu-Hakone bus or the Hakone-Tozan bus from Kowakudani Station. Outside the main building, you can stop at the foot bath cafe where you can order drinks or sweets and gaze at a magnificent Japanese-style mural titled "Wind/Time" by Fukui Kotaro.
sources.shortName: 18 of the Best things to do in Hakone | Japan Travel by NAVITIME

sources.snippet: ‚ñ≤„ÄåOkada Museum of Art in Hakone Kowakudani and Autumn Leaves„Äç. ‚ñ≤„ÄåVibrant Autumn Leaves in Front of Kaikatei, the Dining Area at Okada Museum of Art in Hakone„Äç. The Okada Museum of Art is a five-story building with extensive exhibition spaces showcasing a wealth of masterpieces from ancient to contemporary Japanese and East Asian art.
sources.shortName: A recommended model course for couples to enjoy hot springs and Lake Ashi.
Hakone - GaijinPot Travel

places.name: Okada Museum of Art

reviews.text:
Amazing collection of Asian Art! Exceptional collection of Chinese ceramics. Cell phone and camera must be put in locker before entrance. I guess that's why I didn't know they have such amazing collections from Google photos. If I knew‚Ä¶ I would have planned a whole day here.
Beautiful building and facility. Friendly staff.

Superb museum of Japanese, Korean and Chinese art and ceramics. We saw a special exhibition on the 53 stations of the old T≈çkaid≈ç which had old versions of 55 woodcuts. Quite special.

We spent 4 hours there, it's quite large. There's an udon restaurant in a lovely setting, and a footbath cafe.

The only problem is that ¬•2,800 is quite steep. I think it kept people away, which means it was fairly quiet, even on autumn Sunday. They are also very strict about not bringing in phones or other camera devices, all the way to having a metal detector. There's lots of lockers at the entrance. The building is nice as well but the interior is kept quite dark.
Definitely a top-notch, world-class museum for Japanese, Korean and Chinese ancient works of art worth checking out.  No photography allowed inside.

places.address: 493-1 Kowakudani, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0406, Japan

places.generalDescription: Choanji is an ancient Buddhist temple located in a serene setting surrounded by nature. Established in 1356, the temple features a cemetery and wooded gardens with over 200 disciple statues. The tranquil atmosphere of the bamboo forest adds to its majestic appeal. Visitors can stroll through the beautiful garden, which changes with the seasons, and admire the 500 Arhats, each displaying a unique facial expression.

sources.snippet: Religious monuments like Hakone Shrine and Choanji Temple are well worth the goshuinchou (temple book) stamp. Hakone-Machi was once one of the main routes along an ancient highway linking Eastern and Western Japan and therefore has the stunning Hakone Checkpoint. Slightly further out in Odawara is Odawara Castle, a fine specimen of a castle that historically dates back to Japan‚Äôs 15th century (although it has been rebuilt and restored many times).
sources.shortName: Hakone - GaijinPot Travel

sources.snippet: If you are visiting Hakone in autumn, this might be one of the best spots for some maple extravaganza. Will you just look at the colors!. The entire compound exudes serenity I could really spend hours just talking really, really slow walk.
sources.shortName: 15 Things to Do in Hakone | HAKONE JAPAN

places.name: Ryukozan Choanji „ÄÅ Sotoshu Hanano Temple

reviews.text: Low-key Zen. Nice one.  Acres of wonderful forested walking paths on the hillside behind the temple  buildings ... filled with old trees and statuary.  We were impressed by the numerous volunteer locals meticulously clipping away at the intruding weeds.   Parking, lavatory and cemetery included at no charge!

This is a wonderful temple to visit.  It was a lot of fun to wander the hill covered in statues, and look at their expressions.  They ranged from joyful to angry; bored to pleased, and every emotion in between.  It was also nice and quiet to sit down and meditate for a while.

Beautiful temple with different types of sculptures scattered throughout the forest.
Best time to enjoy during autumn.
Other time forest is full of lush green leaves.

places.address: 82 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

places.generalDescription: Odawara Flower Garden is a delightful park that has been attracting visitors for almost 25 years. It was created to provide a space where people can appreciate beautiful flowers and lush greenery throughout the year. The garden features over 100 varieties of roses, plum trees, and a tropical greenhouse with around 200 species of plum. Additionally, it includes a Japanese garden that looks particularly stunning on rainy days. This urban greening park spans across 10.

sources.shortName: Hakone Travel Guide - What to do in Hakone

places.name: Odawara Flower Garden

reviews.text: Great Spot near odawara. best for picnics. Peaceful. Nature at its best!!! Depending on season you can see variety of roses , Plum or other flowers. Inside the building their is a waterfall surrounded by Flowers, it's cool ! FOOD COFFEE is easy to get there . You can spend whole day there !

Roses bloom in a small area, but there are many types, and each type has a written description, which is a good device to stimulate our interest. It is a pity that there is no English description,though.

The park is also easily accessible from the neighboring Suwanohara Park, making it a great place for lunch, a walk, or a jog on a sunny day.

There are also many kinds of plum trees, and I am already looking forward to the next coming season ‚ùóÔ∏è

17 Feb, 2023  :

There is still time until all plum tree will be in full bloom.

I would especially like to introduce you to Kayoikomachi plum trees.

How deceptively beautiful Kayoikomachi  are!

Ikina na de, koikini shiroi hana sakasu.
Kayoikomachi wa haru wo shirasete.

It is a neat, single-petaled flower of wild plum nature. The flowers are medium sized (about 2.5 cm in diameter) and have a faint crimson tint. Plum blossoms with a faint crimson color like this give a sense of profundity and fragility. The tips of the petals are lightly wavy, the stamens are yellowish, and the bottom of the flower is yellowish brown. Is the name derived from the song "Kayoi Komachi"? When I look at the flower again with this in mind, it seems to be filled with an ethereal atmosphere.

24 May, 2023 :

Lovely roses are in full bloom, dazzling in contrast with the fresh greenery. It is the best time to see them!
Also, don't miss the tuberous fruits on each of the plum trees.
Moreover, if you sit still for a while along the creek, you will be able to enjoy Orthetrum albistylum speciosum(Shioka Tombo), Cercion hieroglyphicum(Ito Tombo) and Butterflies.
Another must-see is Hydrangea(Ajisai), although there are only a few plants, which seem to be eagerly waiting for their season to arrive.
Furthermore, in the early morning, Irises and Lotus flowers are also blooming beautifully.
not easy to find the car park. the road signages are poor. there are plenty of car park lots. the garden is pretty and there is a good view to the city below. Quite a good place to spend an hour.

places.address: 3798-5 Kuno, Odawara, Kanagawa 250-0055, Japan

places.generalDescription: Hakone Checkpoint, located in Hakone-Machi, is a replica of a guardhouse from the Edo era used to inspect travelers and goods along the Tokaido Highway. The site also features remnants of the old highway lined with ancient cedars. History enthusiasts will appreciate its significance as an important site for transportation and communication during the Edo period.

sources.snippet: Hakone-Machi was once one of the main routes along an ancient highway linking Eastern and Western Japan and therefore has the stunning Hakone Checkpoint. Slightly further out in Odawara is Odawara Castle, a fine specimen of a castle that historically dates back to Japan‚Äôs 15th century (although it has been rebuilt and restored many times). Hakone also has many art museums such as the Hakone Open Air Museum and Okada Museum of Art.
sources.shortName: Hakone - GaijinPot Travel

sources.snippet: Hakone was once a major checkpoint along the old Tokaido road, one of five main highways linking Tokyo and Kyoto during the Edo period. Not much remains of the original highway, but there is a pleasant hiking trail along which remains a section of original stone pavement. For this itinerary, you‚Äôll walk along another original section of the Tokaido highway, a 500 metre-long cedar avenue.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Itinerary

sources.snippet: We fossicked through fascinating little shops around the lake edge, and stopped by the Hakone Checkpoint, an authentic reconstruction of a former checkpoint on the major road between Kyoto and Tokyo. Between 1603 and 1868 this checkpoint was tightly controlled, and taxes collected. Now it is an interesting historical site.
sources.shortName: Hakone, Japan: A Unique Destination for a Romantic Getaway

sources.snippet: Continuing on to Hakonemachi-ko, you‚Äôll come across the Hakone Checkpoint. This is a restoration and shows what the Checkpoint would have looked like during the Edo Period. Here you can learn all about the history of the Edo Period.
sources.shortName: Hakone 2 day itinerary: a helpful guide

sources.snippet: H Line bus from Hakone-Yumoto Station (40 minutes, ¬•1,080 without HFP). ¬• 500 ( ¬• 400 with HFP). The Old T≈çkaid≈ç Road was once a vital trade route connecting Tokyo and Kyoto.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Guide: What to Do and Getting There
15 Best Places to visit in Hakone | HAKONE JAPAN

places.name: Hakone Checkpoint

reviews.text: A well organized historical fortress to secure this district. You can see lots of heritage stuffs and designated layout and artwork here. Good to take a look at this place after having the pirate boat cruising. Enjoy.

We visited the Hakone Checkpoint when we were driving through Hakone.  It was a beautiful recreation of the original Tokaido Road Checkpoint.  The displays were very informative, and the views were amazing.

Its important as tourist area before and still famous among locals and foreign tourist till now. Good place for photos, having meals, and shop some local souvenirs. Suitable for any group size or FIT since its open area for everyone to come and enjoy.  Promised amazing panoramic view ...Worth visit

places.address: 1Áï™Âú∞ Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0521, Japan

places.generalDescription: Nestled by the serene shores of Lake Ashinoko, Hakone Hotel offers a tranquil retreat with breathtaking views of Mount Fuji. This charming lakeside resort is easily accessible via a complimentary shuttle from Odawara Station, making it an ideal getaway for travelers. Guests can indulge in stylishly designed onsen facilities that provide a perfect setting for relaxation after a day of exploration. Hakone Hotel boasts comfortable accommodations, including beautifully furnished Japanese-style rooms that promise comfort and stunning vistas.

sources.snippet: Surrounded by bamboo trees and hills, Yoshimatsu is a traditional Sukiya-style Ryokan (inn) with beautiful outdoor hot spring baths. Overlooking Mt. Fuji and Lake Ashi, it provides a free shuttle from Hakone Machi Bus Station. Fitted with tatami-mat flooring, these classic Japanese-style rooms are equipped with a flat-screen TV and Yukatas (Japanese-style bathrobes).
sources.shortName: Hakone Travel Guide - What to do in Hakone

places.name: Hakone Hotel

reviews.text:
Don't be fooled by the ‚Äúfortress‚Äù front of Hakone Hotel when you drive into the carpark. It looks sturdy and cold but you will see the concierge guys coming to you with a warm welcoming smile to greet you and help you with yr luggages! Such a perfect welcome! When you enter into the modern style hotel, you will be impressed by the interior design and gently greeted by the check in staff. We were very blessed to be upgraded to a junior suite. This being our final hotel stay before flying home, we were absolutely awed by this treat from HH! Thank you indeed from the bottom of our hearts!
We loved the view of the lake from our room with a balcony. The beds n pillows are too comfortable & there were plenty of amenities. Very generous. It's the first for us to be told to switch onsens at different time of the day so that both genders can experience the different features of each onsen. Very good idea! üëç But I personally find these onsens a tat too hot for my relaxation. I think 2-3 C degrees lower will be ideal.
The breakfast buffet was just excellent tho we wondered what happened to Japanese since we are in Japan ü§≠. Around the HH there's plenty to do- Pirate ship cruise down Lake Ashi, Togendai ropeway, hiking on either sides of HH around the lake, walking the skywalk suspension bridge etc‚Ä¶ a perfect location. Thanks Hakone Hotel staff for this unforgettable experience! You will be highly recommended!

The hotel is situated in a gorgeous location overlooking lake Ashi wity pirate ships cruising the lake to the ropeway (cable car). Lovely views of the lake, large and comfortable rooms. What let's them down are the food options - dinner portions are absolutely tiny, not particularly tasty and very expensive, so not a great combination. Also, very limited dining options nearby - more for lunch but hardly anything in the evening

The location is very scenic, right off of lake ashi. There are restaurants close by. The onsen is very nice.
However the rooms are very outdated, and most notably, the hotel controls the AC level, you cannot adjust it. If you are an American and like air conditioning, this isn't a good option for you.

places.address: 65 Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0521, Japan

places.generalDescription: Hakone-Yumoto Station is the starting point for a delightful journey through Hakone. The area offers a mix of traditional and modern experiences, such as calligraphy sessions at Fukuju-in Temple, also known as Hakone Kannon. The temple provides English explanations and guidance for visitors, making it foreigner-friendly.

sources.snippet: The shopping arcade in front of Hakone-Yumoto Station offers plenty of options for souvenir-hunters. You‚Äôll want to start at Tanakaya, where the shelves are lined with yosegi marquetry boxes, hot spring minerals and all sorts of other quirky stuff you can only find here. For edible gifts, consider old-school sweets shop Chimoto, found a bit further up towards the hot spring inn area.
sources.shortName: Guide to Hakone: Best things to do, museums, restaurants, hotels and bars

sources.snippet:
First of all, let‚Äôs enjoy the cherry blossoms at Yumotobashi. (Best viewing time: from the last week of March until the first week of April)

9:00 - After arriving at Hakone-Yumoto Station, the first place to visit is Yumotobashi, which is nearby the popular soba shop, Hatsuhana. Hakone-Yumoto Station ‚Üí Yumotobashi

On both banks of the river, elegant cherry blossoms come into bloom.
sources.siteName: HAKONE  | Your Guide to All Things Hakone
sources.shortName: Enjoy Hakone‚Äôs Cherry Blossoms! A Recommended Itinerary From Lake Ashi To Gora | HAKONE

sources.snippet: After a seamless journey (gosh I love train travel in Japan!), we arrived at Hakone-Yamuto station. It‚Äôs a fairly small station, so you can say goodbye to those big/easy to get lost in stations of Tokyo. Exiting the station, we instantly see copious amounts of Odakyu staff.
sources.shortName: Hakone 2 day itinerary: a helpful guide

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôve taken the later train, you‚Äôll arrive around 9:20am. Head towards the exit. If you have luggage or extra bags to leave at the station, there‚Äôs a baggage counter that will take care of them for you ‚Äì they are located outside the ticket barriers.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Itinerary

sources.snippet: The Hakone hot spring town spreads out beyond Hakone Yumoto Station on the Odakyu Line, creating a lively atmosphere. It's perfect for couple dates as you can feel like you're on vacation as soon as you arrive.
sources.shortName: Must-see for couples! 11 Experience / Leisure Spots to Enjoy at Hakone Onsen
Hakone Onsen (Hot Springs) - Miyanoshita, Japan

places.name: Hakone-Yumoto Station

reviews.text:
Iconic train station which is the starting point for many visitors to Hakone. The station is clean and well-maintained, and counter staff were helpful in explaining how the Hakone Free Pass works.
There are also shops selling food here too, and the shopping street is just a short walk away.

Visited in May 2023 and November 2024.
Beautiful train station. More than a transit place from Odawara station to Hakone. Close to a beautiful bridge and a street with many food stores. Nice to walk around this area.

Hakone-Yumoto Station was easy to navigate, and it was straightforward to find English information to continue my trip. The station is well-signposted and organized, making it convenient for travelers to access the information and services they need for their journey through Hakone.

places.address: Yumoto, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0311, Japan

places.generalDescription: KIKKA-SO is a traditional Japanese restaurant housed in a historic Sukiya Shoin style building that was originally constructed in 1895 as an imperial villa. The restaurant offers an upscale dining experience, serving seasonal Japanese cuisine in a beautiful setting surrounded by Japanese architecture and gardens. Visitors can enjoy a well-balanced course menu featuring abundant autumn flavors, with each dish carefully prepared to be delicious and visually appealing.

sources.snippet: Kikka-so Inn ‚Äì This traditional Japanese cuisine was originally built in 1895 for the Imperial family. The Japanese architecture and gardens provide a beautiful setting to enjoy an upscale, seasonal Japanese meal.
sources.shortName: Hakone Onsen (Hot Springs) - Miyanoshita, Japan

places.name: KIKKA-SO

reviews.text: The food was really amazing. I ordered Kikka-so kaiseki and was really not dissapointed. Most of the dishes were really tasty and there were so many different flavours to enjoy. The only dish I didnt like was "squid dressed with salted and fermented bonito guts". Otherwise I liked that portions were smaller as there was a lot of courses. Sake was also great!

THE FOOD IS SO BAD. I got the 27,000 yen Kikukaiseki because the front desk lady told me it was going to be everything premium and it was a complete scam. The food was horrible, portions were extremely small. I even got my ‚Äúmeat dish‚Äù cold.

Honestly I'm extremely frustrated with the situation because it is not a good price for value. It's also one of my last nights in Japan so it's a shame I ate here.

The place itself is cool. This is the only place I didn't like the food in Japan.

Honestly would not recommend, the food quality is cheat Chinese all you can eat in the USA type of vibe. Even the sashimi was bad. How can you make bad sashimi in JAPAN? .

Beautiful restaurant with great setting. Services were so great, especially the waitress that served 11 of us the whole lunch. We were led to the restaurant from the hotel foyer, as the restaurant is outside of the hotel compound. 3 star for the food, nothing surprising, but the private room we booked was just perfect. The booking experience was tiring, but I am glad they adjust the menu to fit the dietary requirements. Still worth a visit, but don't expect much about the food.

places.address: 359 Miyanoshita, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0404, Japan

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Sengokuhara Onsen, Hakone Botanical Garden of Wetlands, also known as Hakone Shissei Kaen, is a captivating showcase of approximately 200 species unique to Japan's wetlands. The garden boasts an impressive collection of over 1,100 highland plants and various forest and grassland species.

sources.snippet: The Hakone Botanical Garden of Wetlands, home to approximately 1,700 plant species, reaches its peak blooming season from late May to June. More than 100 varieties of flowers can be viewed simultaneously, with particularly impressive colonies of Nikko Kisuge (Day lily) and Shobu (Japanese iris). For the 2025 season, the garden will host special evening illumination events and botanical festivals.
sources.shortName: Hakone in May 2025: Highlights, Events & Festivals

sources.snippet: The Hakone Botanical Garden of Wetlands is a large park showcasing over 1700 varieties of marsh and alpine plants. It‚Äôs far more interesting than it might sound at first. Not only will you walk through different types of marshland from fens to bogs, and see dozens of different flowers, a walk through this verdant plant wonderland is just such a great way to begin your morning.
sources.shortName: Hakone Day Trip Itinerary

places.name: Hakone Botanical Garden of Wetlands

reviews.text:
Went during light shower rain but that made it even better!

Staff were kind, ticket buying process was easy, you can park in the car park nearby for free.

Not many flowers when I went, but you see many crawdads, a carnivorous plants section, and can walk around 7 more sections of different themes(swamp, wetlands etc). There is a little shop there too for cute bits and bobs.
If you're into plants or nature person, then recommend! Depending on the season, there are different flowers blooming. They have few carnival plants, which was cool. Entrance 700 yen.

Not many brightly colored flowers but so many other species of leaf like plants! Definitely recommend if interested in flowers! 700 yen entrance and scenic walking route. Recommend umbrella if visiting on a sunny day!

places.address: 817 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan
